author: lidonation
title: Cardano & Catalyst data Web Embeds
description: There's currently no way to embed rich charts and live Cardano data on websites. Teams have to host and recreate the same data visualizations or use static screenshots to tell stories.

f6_assessments.q0:
LIDO Nation's existing Project Catalyst dashboard is pretty slick, presenting data in visually appealing, easily digestible blocks. If the proposer is able to deliver charts and data about the Cardano ecosystem in a portable form without the need to host the data on local servers, it would likely go a long way towards promoting Cardano projects and metrics to the general public. 

One could make the case that this project could fit in the Developer Ecosystem category, but its functionality and sustainability model more closely mimic that of many existing SaaS integrations, so it's probably fine where it is. 

On that note, the business model aspect of this proposal is perhaps as important to it as the product itself. LIDO Nation will essentially leverage the Cardano stake pool system, as well as its own tokens and NFTs, in a way to make the components accessible to a large audience for "free." While there's no guarantee the Rising Tide model will work, the ramifications if it does are significant, as it would demonstrate the viability of model in which the user does not permanently lose money, but still contributes to the sustainability of resources. In that sense, Cardano Components is conducting two very useful experiments for the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
Darlington and James look to be a solid pair to lead this task, bringing together engineering knowledge and education. As noted above, LIDO Nation's Catalyst stats are attractive and easily read. 

The project's design is to be self-sustaining after this round of funding, with budget outlays made for learning modules to encourage the creation of additional components down the road. Given that LIDO Nation is already creating attractive charts, the timeline appears to be reasonable for creating an infrastructure for components with API access. 

The budget looks reasonable, but we need some clarification on the Component & Blockchain Developer line item, which is for 100 hours of Senior Developer work at $75/hr. That still leaves $1,500 of the requested funds unaccounted for. Is this a typo, or will those additional funds be used elsewhere in development?

Questions, of course, will remain as to whether the Rising Tides model can sustain this project indefinitely.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditability for the components should, as the proposer claims, be pretty straightforward. Stakeholders will know rather quickly if the components offered work or not when completed. In the interim, auditors will be able to follow the open source development of the project.

The success of the Rising Tide model will be harder to assess, and will be dependent largely on the proposer's self-reporting. As it's not the primary deliverable, however, I'm not factoring that aspect into my scoring here. Nevertheless, brownie points if the proposer comes up with a system for tracking the monetization outcomes of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The Cardano & Catalyst Data Web embeds proposal is developing open-source web components library that has rich visualization and presentation of up-to-project catalyst data. It will be possible to sign up for the service, grab embed code, then show rich data with no maintenance. It will benefit developers in their own Tech Stack along with people who want to learn about Cardano development: Project based learning (PBL). The project also plan to scale the project with RisingTide revenue model designed to increase community engagement. The proposal fits the DApp, Products and Integration very well in that the integration will lay groundwork for the community to visualize the ecosystem better and increase interest in new people groups. The risk for this project is community buy-in which the team will try to tackle with RisingTide revenue model. The team mentions that the service is for free if the individual participate in cardano communities who are  focused on education, open source blockchain tooling, DAO enablement and community building. However, it will be tricky for them to classify people working on projects which may not be directly related to education, open source tool or DAO enablement as they stipulate. Since the project is funded with catalyst community, wouldn't it be fairer that it is free for all? Hope that the team would consider other revenue model ie. premium subscription etc. instead of charging some but not all based on their area of involvement.
f6_assessments.q1: There are 3 steps involved with this project with completion of step 1: getting started in 2 months. step 2: develop PBL modules (developers to use existing components in their own projects and contribute to a growing library and beta test and initial rollout by end of month 3. Step 3: Public library, documentation and incentive implementation. Total project length is 6 months and beyond with RisingTide Model. The budget breakdown is detailed and sensible. The project will be led by 2 individuals who are very much involved with community. The RisingTide model for later period is a good idea as delegation and NFT sale to incentivize their participation in creating new components. However, hope the team would consider the free for all users in the beginning (maybe at least the first 6 months) and then later implement the RisingTide Model.
f6_assessments.q2: The success of this proposal is that the community come together to create new components. Since the code is open source, it will be fairly straightforward for community to track. There will be 4 outputs ready for the community upon the new release: 4 starter component, 4 additional component for bounty deliverables, website hosting all components and Gimbalab PBL modules. The community can track buy-in contribution along with the adoption easily. It would be useful to check in the project after the RisingTide model after it is implemented (6 months later) whether it is the model to go for in future or after charging and they might realize reducing community engagement.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal suggests that there is currently no way to embed rich charts and live Cardano data on websites. With this challenge in the community, LIDO Nation Foundation plans to create a website that promotes education within the community. They will do this by allowing their product to host their own infrastructure so that teams of certain projects don't have to. This proposal plans to bring more utility to the ecosystem by improving these steps. This will benefit both developers working on projects and community members that are interested in development such as Program based learning. This could have a positive impact on the Cardano community by promoting decentralization due to implementation of DAOs in their project and creating tools that benefit different members of the community. For these reasons, I give this section 4 out of 5 stars. I think that the team can be a little more specific in the solution category. Readers of the proposal may struggle to find exactly what the solution to the challenge is until reading further into the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal includes the specific details of the team members. It lists their experience and accomplishments and even provides their Linkedin profiles. This is very important to include because it shows that the team is confident with being held accountable for this proposal. It shows that they are dedicated to creating this project and fulfilling their promises as stated in their proposal. These details can be found in their roadmap section. Their roadmap is split up into three different section and states that this entire project will take about 6 months. This may seem simple, but it is extremely important when determining the likelihood of this proposal being implemented successfully. This is because it gives specific details that will allow for the community to hold them accountable to. There is also a detailed budget breakdown. Within this section, they explain where all of the requested funds will be used. The requested funds add up with their proposed roadmap and leads me to believe that the plan provided, and the teams experience will likely lead to a successful proposal. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: I was satisfied with the amount of information and details in this proposal. All of the information helps suggest that the team will be capable of creating their Web Embeds. There will be implementation that allows for more tools for builders and community members of interest. The team at Lido Nation Foundation and Gimbalabs have given their personal details and in a sense have provided KYC verification. This helps the community to hold them accountable to this proposal. As stated above, there is also specific details and timeframes that the team plans to reach. The team should remain transparent with the community and be open to suggestions and comments. When the team is transparent with the community and trust is built between the team and community, there is more room for accountability. This will help ensure that the team accomplishes what they set out to do and that the requested funds will be allocated properly. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars. There can be a lot of utility that comes from this project and it is likely that the team behind this proposal will be successful with their plan.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge is trying to drive adoption of cardano and catalyst is a crucial part of the ecosystem. The team suggests to increase ecosystem visibility by developing web components to display live cardano and catalyst data. Very interestingly they suggest a community buy in program to incentivize further development. If this proves to be sustainable it could have quite the impact and maybe serve as blueprint for similar endeavors. Both problem statement and solution are reasonable and i strongly agree they fit the challenge well.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members are stated explicitly with proven track record within the cardano ecosystem. A detailed roadmap with clear deliverables for the complete 6 month project runtime has been provided and a empty Github repo is already available for future sourcecode. The team already provides an outlook beyond the project scope as well which suggests they have a bigger picture for future expansion in mind. The funding breakdown includes items for documentation/training (very important as they want to bring their libraries as open source project to the community) as well as operational costs (important for longer term availability). Their approach to sustainability is pretty unique with their buy in program and offers a good chance to not require additional future funding. Risks are clearly stated and the team seems to actively manage them which testifies to a professional approach. Based on the information and track record provided i strongly agree the team will be capable of delivering the proposed libraries and services.
f6_assessments.q2: Their open source approach and aim for active collaboration within the community will give the ecosystem a good chance of tracking the progress. The team also provided some high level goals/outputs the community can expect and some high level success criteria. Would have been nice to see some metrics on how to measure these. Apart from that i think they outlined a good approach to auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem with this challenge is that it is not possible to put Cardano charts and data directly on the web pages, which is a necessity and it is related to this challenge. well-defined authored solution LIDO Nation is famous for displaying Catalyst data on website they have created an open source component library that allows integration of Catalyst and Cardano visualizations into any website that they want. This solution can solve the current problem of this challenge. This proposal can scale to solve future challenges and help more people know about Cardano. The author also points out the risks they may take in this challenge as the unknowns and challenges associated with this concept. They are not sure how the market and the community will react. Does it really raise the bar for both Gimbalabs, Lido Nation and other communities to encourage continued growth? However, the author also has a solution for those risks that does not affect the current problem of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has identified clear timelines that the author divides into 4 development phases for this project: initiation phase, PBL module development phase, document public library phase and initial implementation of incentives for building components, phase 4 runs collaborative tests that bridge between Lido Nation and Gimbalabs and additional DAOs to further develop the RisingTide model. The implementation time is reasonable with the results of the work, the goals are listed in detail by the author for each task. The success of the project is entirely related to the challenges of the campaign. Success is like community involvement in the creation of new components, and the community also accepts the use of creating web components. The solution to this challenge is to address many of the key areas of "Dapps, Products & Integrations". This is a good project if funded I believe the project will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics provided by the proponent they listed the 4 proposed results as: 4 starter components, 4 additional components from bonus delivery, website hosting all the ingredients. Gimbalabs PBL module. The team has 2 main members implementing this project: Darlington is an engineer, a dancer, a humanitarian, an idealist and an entrepreneur. Darlington has deep knowledge of blockchain technology and broad experience in the Cardano ecosystem. James is the developer of Project Based Learning modules to help community contributors move from hiding, to ideating, to contributing. The grant budget for this project is $14,920 below the $20 budget of the entire challenge. The budget is explained deeply and reasonably by the author in each spending item. Divided by the author into 5 milestones that need to be spent for this proposal are: incentive for individual developers with an amount of $1,000 to spend, component and blockchain developers with an amount to spend $ 9,000, project manager for $1,200, server and storage for 1yr for $720, documentation and course creation for $3,000. These expenditures are completely consistent with the challenge that the author has set out.

solution: LIDO Nation has a reputation for visualizing Catalyst data on our website. Create an open-source component library that allows Catalyst and Cardano visualizations to be integrated into any website.
experience:
Darlington is a co-dreamer at Lido Nation & the developer behind lido's catalyst research tool, voter too, and visualizations.
James is a co-founder at Gimbalabs and is currently focused on creating tools that make it easier for other people to start building on Cardano.
